description: Borrowed from Latin facinorōsus, from facinus (“deed, bad deed”), from facio (“to make, to do”).

adjectives.description: facinorous (comparative more facinorous, superlative most facinorous)

examples: Tru. I would kill you, Sir, I would kill you, if you had.   Mor. Why? you do more in this, Sir: it were a vengeance centuple, for all facinorous Acts, that could be nam'd, to do that you do.
